Issues.Title: WPF app Tooltips always on top of every application
Issues.Body:
Tooltips of wpfs apps always appear on top and also inside of windows of other applications.
That doesn't feel right.

https://github.com/dotnet/wpf/assets/71928731/d152b259-e197-4286-b17b-be535b5a62d5

This behaviour can be confusing users, because sometimes (not always) they see tooltips, when they for example write an email in Outlook and concurrently a wpf app is open in the background:

![Clipboard-File-1](https://github.com/dotnet/wpf/assets/71928731/dd48b8cf-b8d3-460e-8a98-45cfe351eb66)

How can this behaviour be suppressed?
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "WPF app Tooltips always on top of every application" (#8671)

Issues.Title: Inconsistent Animations and Effects in Windows 11 Styles
Issues.Body:
### Description

The effects designed in the windows 11 styles have fixed brush values for events such as hover or keyboard focus. This causes inconsistent results when properties such as `Background`, `Foreground`, `BorderBrush` etc are set in an application.

### Reproduction Steps

An example to demonstrate this inconsistence involves following steps:
1) Create a WPF application that supports windows 11 styles
2) Create a text box and specify its background to red and foreground to yellow.
3) Hover over the text box or select the text box.

### Expected behavior

The text box should have a background which is a lighter shade of red in this case and while typing the color of text should be yellow.

### Actual behavior

The text box has a whitish/greyish color and while typing the text color is white.

### Regression?

_No response_

### Known Workarounds

_No response_

### Impact

_No response_

### Configuration

.NET 9
Windows 11
x64

### Other information

_No response_
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Inconsistent Animations and Effects in Windows 11 Styles" (#8670)

Issues.Title: Fix Accessibility and Navigation Issues in DataGrid
Issues.Body:
Fixes #8668 

## Description
Enabled Tab Navigation of cells by removing the the tab that was explicitly disabling it.
Added triggers to aid the visual appearance of selected cell and row of a DataGrid.

## Regression
_None_

## Testing
Local Build Pass
Sample Application Testing


###### Microsoft Reviewers: [Open in CodeFlow](https://portal.fabricbot.ms/api/codeflow?pullrequest=https://github.com/dotnet/wpf/pull/8669)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "Fix Accessibility and Navigation Issues in DataGrid" (#8669)

Issues.Title: DataGrid does not support Tab navigation and Accessibility
Issues.Body:
### Description

DataGrid design in Windows 11 styling does not support navigating cells using Tab key. It also has accessibility issues. The selected cell is not focused and hence the issue in identifying the current row and cell.

### Reproduction Steps

1) Create a WPF application that supports windows 11 styles.
2) Initialize a DataGrid in it
3) Click on any of the cell and check its visual appearance
4) Try navigating using TAB key

### Expected behavior

Tab Key navigation and highlighting/bordering of cells that are currently selected

### Actual behavior

Tab navigation is disabled.
The visual appearance does not change.

### Regression?

_No response_

### Known Workarounds

_No response_

### Impact

_No response_

### Configuration

.NET 9
Windows 11
x64

### Other information

_No response_
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "DataGrid does not support Tab navigation and Accessibility" (#8668)

Issues.Title: Import FluentWindow and TitleBar
Issues.Body:
Import FluentWindow and TitleBar
Draft PR to fix theming issues. Need to import FluentWindow and TitleBar for dark/light theming issues.

Issues.Title: Fix TabStripPlacement not Respected in Tabcontrol
Issues.Body:
Fixes #8606


## Description
The `TabControl` does not respect the property `TabStripPlacement` when using Windows 11 Themes. 

## Customer Impact
The new themes won't support layout designed to have Tab Items Placed on Right, Left or Bottom.

## Regression
_None_

## Testing
Local Build Pass
Sample Application Testing
<!-- What kind of testing has been done with the fix. -->

Issues.Title: Fix ExpandDirection not respected in Expander
Issues.Body:
Fixes #8651 

## Description
The `ExpandDirection` property of an Expander does not work in Windows 11 styles. Irrespective of the value provided to `ExpandDirection` it always opens downwards.

## Customer Impact
The new themes won't support layout designed to have expander opening left, right or upwards.

## Regression
_None_

## Testing
Local Build Pass
Sample Application Testing

Issues.Title: ExpandDirection of an Expander not respected in Windows 11 Styles
Issues.Body:
### Description

The `ExpandDirection` property of an Expander does not work in Windows 11 styles. Irrespective of the value provided to `ExpandDirection` it always opens downwards.

### Reproduction Steps

Create a WPF Application supporting windows 11 themes. Create an expander with `ExpandDirection` property set to either `Right` or `Left` or `Up`.

### Expected behavior

The Expansion should happen in accordance to the value specified to `ExpandDirection`

### Actual behavior

The Expansion of contents happen downwards.

### Regression?

_No response_

### Known Workarounds

_No response_

### Impact

Incorrect layout of applications designed to cater the specific needs.

### Configuration

.NET 9
Windows 11
x64

### Other information

_No response_
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "ExpandDirection of an Expander not respected in Windows 11 Styles" (#8651)

Issues.Title: ComboBox does not properly support Voice Access
Issues.Body:
### Description

When using a combo box, Voice Access is not able to find the box to click/expand based on the selected value.

### Reproduction Steps

Create a new WPF project, and add a ComboBox with some items in it.

```xaml
<Window x:Class="blankwpf.MainWindow"
        xmlns="http://schemas.microsoft.com/winfx/2006/xaml/presentation"
        xmlns:x="http://schemas.microsoft.com/winfx/2006/xaml"
        xmlns:d="http://schemas.microsoft.com/expression/blend/2008"
        xmlns:mc="http://schemas.openxmlformats.org/markup-compatibility/2006"
        xmlns:local="clr-namespace:blankwpf"
        mc:Ignorable="d"
        Title="MainWindow" Height="450" Width="800">
    <Grid>
        <ComboBox Width="500" Height="20" SelectedIndex="2">
            <ComboBoxItem Content="item 1" />
            <ComboBoxItem Content="item 2" />
            <ComboBoxItem Content="item 3" />
        </ComboBox>
    </Grid>
</Window>
```

Run the application and start Voice Access. "item 3" will be selected by default.

### Expected behavior

Because "item 3" is selected, saying "click item 3" should click and thus expand the combo box.

### Actual behavior

Voice access says "We can't find item three. Please try again."

### Regression?

_No response_

### Known Workarounds

_No response_

### Impact

Users cannot use Voice Access to intuitively interact with combo boxes.

### Configuration

_No response_

### Other information

_No response_
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "ComboBox does not properly support Voice Access" (#8649)
